text: XVIII
text_tokenized: XVIII

text: Mr. Frank Churchill did not come .
text_tokenized: Mr. Frank Churchill did not come .

text: When the time proposed drew near , Mrs. Weston 's fears were justified in the arrival of a letter of excuse .
text_tokenized: When the time proposed drew near , Mrs. Weston 's fears were justified in the arrival of a letter of excuse .

text: For the present , he could not be spared , to his " very great mortification and regret ; but still he looked forward with the hope of coming to Randalls at no distant period . "
text_tokenized: For the present , he could not be spared , to his " very great mortification and regret ; but still he looked forward with the hope of coming to Randalls at no distant period . "

text: Mrs. Weston was exceedingly disappointed -- much more disappointed , in fact , than her husband , though her dependence on seeing the young man had been so much more sober : but a sanguine temper , though for ever expecting more good than occurs , does not always pay for its hopes by any proportionate depression .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Weston was exceedingly disappointed -- much more disappointed , in fact , than her husband , though her dependence on seeing the young man had been so much more sober : but a sanguine temper , though for ever expecting more good than occurs , does not always pay for its hopes by any proportionate depression .

text: It soon flies over the present failure , and begins to hope again .
text_tokenized: It soon flies over the present failure , and begins to hope again .

text: For half an hour Mr. Weston was surprized and sorry ; but then he began to perceive that Frank 's coming two or three months later would be a much better plan ; better time of year ; better weather ; and that he would be able , without any doubt , to stay considerably longer with them than if he had come sooner .
text_tokenized: For half an hour Mr. Weston was surprized and sorry ; but then he began to perceive that Frank 's coming two or three months later would be a much better plan ; better time of year ; better weather ; and that he would be able , without any doubt , to stay considerably longer with them than if he had come sooner .

text: These feelings rapidly restored his comfort , while Mrs. Weston , of a more apprehensive disposition , foresaw nothing but a repetition of excuses and delays ; and after all her concern for what her husband was to suffer , suffered a great deal more herself .
text_tokenized: These feelings rapidly restored his comfort , while Mrs. Weston , of a more apprehensive disposition , foresaw nothing but a repetition of excuses and delays ; and after all her concern for what her husband was to suffer , suffered a great deal more herself .

text: Emma was not at this time in a state of spirits to care really about Mr. Frank Churchill 's not coming , except as a disappointment at Randalls . The acquaintance at present had no charm for her .
text_tokenized: Emma was not at this time in a state of spirits to care really about Mr. Frank Churchill 's not coming , except as a disappointment at Randalls . The acquaintance at present had no charm for her .

text: She wanted , rather , to be quiet , and out of temptation ; but still , as it was desirable that she should appear , in general , like her usual self , she took care to express as much interest in the circumstance , and enter as warmly into Mr. and Mrs. Weston 's disappointment , as might naturally belong to their friendship .
text_tokenized: She wanted , rather , to be quiet , and out of temptation ; but still , as it was desirable that she should appear , in general , like her usual self , she took care to express as much interest in the circumstance , and enter as warmly into Mr. and Mrs. Weston 's disappointment , as might naturally belong to their friendship .

text: She was the first to announce it to Mr. Knightley ; and exclaimed quite as much as was necessary , ( or , being acting a part , perhaps rather more , ) at the conduct of the Churchills , in keeping him away .
text_tokenized: She was the first to announce it to Mr. Knightley ; and exclaimed quite as much as was necessary , ( or , being acting a part , perhaps rather more , ) at the conduct of the Churchills , in keeping him away .

text: She then proceeded to say a good deal more than she felt , of the advantage of such an addition to their confined society in Surry ; the pleasure of looking at somebody new ; the gala - day to Highbury entire , which the sight of him would have made ; and ending with reflections on the Churchills again , found herself directly involved in a disagreement with Mr. Knightley ; and , to her great amusement , perceived that she was taking the other side of the question from her real opinion , and making use of Mrs. Weston 's arguments against herself .
text_tokenized: She then proceeded to say a good deal more than she felt , of the advantage of such an addition to their confined society in Surry ; the pleasure of looking at somebody new ; the gala - day to Highbury entire , which the sight of him would have made ; and ending with reflections on the Churchills again , found herself directly involved in a disagreement with Mr. Knightley ; and , to her great amusement , perceived that she was taking the other side of the question from her real opinion , and making use of Mrs. Weston 's arguments against herself .

text: " The Churchills are very likely in fault , " said Mr. Knightley , coolly ; " but I dare say he might come if he would .
text_tokenized: " The Churchills are very likely in fault , " said Mr. Knightley , coolly ; " but I dare say he might come if he would .

text: " " I do not know why you should say so .
text_tokenized: " " I do not know why you should say so .

text: He wishes exceedingly to come ; but his uncle and aunt will not spare him .
text_tokenized: He wishes exceedingly to come ; but his uncle and aunt will not spare him .

text: " " I can not believe that he has not the power of coming , if he made a point of it .
text_tokenized: " " I can not believe that he has not the power of coming , if he made a point of it .

text: It is too unlikely , for me to believe it without proof .
text_tokenized: It is too unlikely , for me to believe it without proof .

text: " How odd you are !
text_tokenized: " How odd you are !

text: What has Mr. Frank Churchill done , to make you suppose him such an unnatural creature ? " " I am not supposing him at all an unnatural creature , in suspecting that he may have learnt to be above his connexions , and to care very little for any thing but his own pleasure , from living with those who have always set him the example of it . It is a great deal more natural than one could wish , that a young man , brought up by those who are proud , luxurious , and selfish , should be proud , luxurious , and selfish too .
text_tokenized: What has Mr. Frank Churchill done , to make you suppose him such an unnatural creature ? " " I am not supposing him at all an unnatural creature , in suspecting that he may have learnt to be above his connexions , and to care very little for any thing but his own pleasure , from living with those who have always set him the example of it . It is a great deal more natural than one could wish , that a young man , brought up by those who are proud , luxurious , and selfish , should be proud , luxurious , and selfish too .

text: If Frank Churchill had wanted to see his father , he would have contrived it between September and January .
text_tokenized: If Frank Churchill had wanted to see his father , he would have contrived it between September and January .

text: A man at his age -- what is he?--three or four - and - twenty -- cannot be without the means of doing as much as that . It is impossible .
text_tokenized: A man at his age -- what is he?--three or four - and - twenty -- cannot be without the means of doing as much as that . It is impossible .

text: " That 's easily said , and easily felt by you , who have always been your own master .
text_tokenized: " That 's easily said , and easily felt by you , who have always been your own master .

text: You are the worst judge in the world , Mr. Knightley , of the difficulties of dependence .
text_tokenized: You are the worst judge in the world , Mr. Knightley , of the difficulties of dependence .

text: You do not know what it is to have tempers to manage .
text_tokenized: You do not know what it is to have tempers to manage .

text: " It is not to be conceived that a man of three or four - and - twenty should not have liberty of mind or limb to that amount .
text_tokenized: " It is not to be conceived that a man of three or four - and - twenty should not have liberty of mind or limb to that amount .

text: He can not want money -- he can not want leisure .
text_tokenized: He can not want money -- he can not want leisure .

text: We know , on the contrary , that he has so much of both , that he is glad to get rid of them at the idlest haunts in the kingdom .
text_tokenized: We know , on the contrary , that he has so much of both , that he is glad to get rid of them at the idlest haunts in the kingdom .

text: We hear of him for ever at some watering - place or other .
text_tokenized: We hear of him for ever at some watering - place or other .

text: A little while ago , he was at Weymouth .
text_tokenized: A little while ago , he was at Weymouth .

text: This proves that he can leave the Churchills .
text_tokenized: This proves that he can leave the Churchills .

text: " " Yes , sometimes he can .
text_tokenized: " " Yes , sometimes he can .

text: " And those times are whenever he thinks it worth his while ; whenever there is any temptation of pleasure . " " It is very unfair to judge of any body 's conduct , without an intimate knowledge of their situation .
text_tokenized: " And those times are whenever he thinks it worth his while ; whenever there is any temptation of pleasure . " " It is very unfair to judge of any body 's conduct , without an intimate knowledge of their situation .

text: Nobody , who has not been in the interior of a family , can say what the difficulties of any individual of that family may be .
text_tokenized: Nobody , who has not been in the interior of a family , can say what the difficulties of any individual of that family may be .

text: We ought to be acquainted with Enscombe , and with Mrs. Churchill 's temper , before we pretend to decide upon what her nephew can do .
text_tokenized: We ought to be acquainted with Enscombe , and with Mrs. Churchill 's temper , before we pretend to decide upon what her nephew can do .

text: He may , at times , be able to do a great deal more than he can at others .
text_tokenized: He may , at times , be able to do a great deal more than he can at others .

text: " " There is one thing , Emma , which a man can always do , if he chuses , and that is , his duty ; not by manoeuvring and finessing , but by vigour and resolution .
text_tokenized: " " There is one thing , Emma , which a man can always do , if he chuses , and that is , his duty ; not by manoeuvring and finessing , but by vigour and resolution .

text: It is Frank Churchill 's duty to pay this attention to his father .
text_tokenized: It is Frank Churchill 's duty to pay this attention to his father .

text: He knows it to be so , by his promises and messages ; but if he wished to do it , it might be done .
text_tokenized: He knows it to be so , by his promises and messages ; but if he wished to do it , it might be done .

text: A man who felt rightly would say at once , simply and resolutely , to Mrs. Churchill-- ` Every sacrifice of mere pleasure you will always find me ready to make to your convenience ; but I must go and see my father immediately .
text_tokenized: A man who felt rightly would say at once , simply and resolutely , to Mrs. Churchill-- ` Every sacrifice of mere pleasure you will always find me ready to make to your convenience ; but I must go and see my father immediately .

text: I know he would be hurt by my failing in such a mark of respect to him on the present occasion .
text_tokenized: I know he would be hurt by my failing in such a mark of respect to him on the present occasion .

text: I shall , therefore , set off to - morrow . '-- If he would say so to her at once , in the tone of decision becoming a man , there would be no opposition
text_tokenized: I shall , therefore , set off to - morrow . '-- If he would say so to her at once , in the tone of decision becoming a man , there would be no opposition

text: made to his going
text_tokenized: made to his going

text: " " No , " said Emma , laughing ; " but perhaps there might be some made to his coming back again .
text_tokenized: " " No , " said Emma , laughing ; " but perhaps there might be some made to his coming back again .

text: Such language for a young man entirely dependent , to use!--Nobody but you , Mr. Knightley , would imagine it possible .
text_tokenized: Such language for a young man entirely dependent , to use!--Nobody but you , Mr. Knightley , would imagine it possible .

text: But you have not an idea of what is requisite in situations directly opposite to your own .
text_tokenized: But you have not an idea of what is requisite in situations directly opposite to your own .

text: Mr. Frank Churchill to be making such a speech as that to the uncle and aunt , who have brought him up , and are to provide for him!--Standing up in the middle of the room , I suppose , and speaking as loud as he could!--How can you imagine such conduct practicable ? "
text_tokenized: Mr. Frank Churchill to be making such a speech as that to the uncle and aunt , who have brought him up , and are to provide for him!--Standing up in the middle of the room , I suppose , and speaking as loud as he could!--How can you imagine such conduct practicable ? "

text: " Depend upon it , Emma , a sensible man would find no difficulty in it .
text_tokenized: " Depend upon it , Emma , a sensible man would find no difficulty in it .

text: He would feel himself in the right ; and the declaration -- made , of course , as a man of sense would make it , in a proper manner-- would do him more good , raise him higher , fix his interest stronger with the people he depended on , than all that a line of shifts and expedients can ever do . Respect would be added to affection .
text_tokenized: He would feel himself in the right ; and the declaration -- made , of course , as a man of sense would make it , in a proper manner-- would do him more good , raise him higher , fix his interest stronger with the people he depended on , than all that a line of shifts and expedients can ever do . Respect would be added to affection .

text: They would feel that they could trust him ; that the nephew who had done rightly by his father , would do rightly by them ; for they know , as well as he does , as well as all the world must know , that he ought to pay this visit to his father ; and while meanly exerting their power to delay it , are in their hearts not thinking the better of him for submitting to their whims .
text_tokenized: They would feel that they could trust him ; that the nephew who had done rightly by his father , would do rightly by them ; for they know , as well as he does , as well as all the world must know , that he ought to pay this visit to his father ; and while meanly exerting their power to delay it , are in their hearts not thinking the better of him for submitting to their whims .

text: Respect for right conduct is felt by every body .
text_tokenized: Respect for right conduct is felt by every body .

text: If he would act in this sort of manner , on principle , consistently , regularly , their little minds would bend to his .
text_tokenized: If he would act in this sort of manner , on principle , consistently , regularly , their little minds would bend to his .

text: " " I rather doubt that .
text_tokenized: " " I rather doubt that .

text: You are very fond of bending little minds ; but where little minds belong to rich people in authority , I think they have a knack of swelling out , till they are quite as unmanageable as great ones . I can imagine , that if you , as you are , Mr. Knightley , were to be transported and placed all at once in Mr. Frank Churchill 's situation , you would be able to say and do just what you have been recommending for him ; and it might have a very good effect .
text_tokenized: You are very fond of bending little minds ; but where little minds belong to rich people in authority , I think they have a knack of swelling out , till they are quite as unmanageable as great ones . I can imagine , that if you , as you are , Mr. Knightley , were to be transported and placed all at once in Mr. Frank Churchill 's situation , you would be able to say and do just what you have been recommending for him ; and it might have a very good effect .

text: The Churchills might not have a word to say in return ; but then , you would have no habits of early obedience and long observance to break through .
text_tokenized: The Churchills might not have a word to say in return ; but then , you would have no habits of early obedience and long observance to break through .

text: To him who has , it might not be so easy to burst forth at once into perfect independence , and set all their claims on his gratitude and regard at nought . He may have as strong a sense of what would be right , as you can have , without being so equal , under particular circumstances , to act up to it .
text_tokenized: To him who has , it might not be so easy to burst forth at once into perfect independence , and set all their claims on his gratitude and regard at nought . He may have as strong a sense of what would be right , as you can have , without being so equal , under particular circumstances , to act up to it .

text: " Then it would not be so strong a sense .
text_tokenized: " Then it would not be so strong a sense .

text: If it failed to produce equal exertion , it could not be an equal conviction . " " Oh , the difference of situation and habit !
text_tokenized: If it failed to produce equal exertion , it could not be an equal conviction . " " Oh , the difference of situation and habit !

text: I wish you would try to understand what an amiable young man may be likely to feel in directly opposing those , whom as child and boy he has been looking up to all his life .
text_tokenized: I wish you would try to understand what an amiable young man may be likely to feel in directly opposing those , whom as child and boy he has been looking up to all his life .

text: " " Our amiable young man is a very weak young man , if this be the first occasion of his carrying through a resolution to do right against the will of others .
text_tokenized: " " Our amiable young man is a very weak young man , if this be the first occasion of his carrying through a resolution to do right against the will of others .

text: It ought to have been a habit with him by this time , of following his duty , instead of consulting expediency .
text_tokenized: It ought to have been a habit with him by this time , of following his duty , instead of consulting expediency .

text: I can allow for the fears of the child , but not of the man .
text_tokenized: I can allow for the fears of the child , but not of the man .

text: As he became rational , he ought to have roused himself and shaken off all that was unworthy in their authority .
text_tokenized: As he became rational , he ought to have roused himself and shaken off all that was unworthy in their authority .

text: He ought to have opposed the first attempt on their side to make him slight his father .
text_tokenized: He ought to have opposed the first attempt on their side to make him slight his father .

text: Had he begun as he ought , there would have been no difficulty now . " " We shall never agree about him , " cried Emma ; " but that is nothing extraordinary .
text_tokenized: Had he begun as he ought , there would have been no difficulty now . " " We shall never agree about him , " cried Emma ; " but that is nothing extraordinary .

text: I have not the least idea of his being a weak young man : I feel sure that he is not .
text_tokenized: I have not the least idea of his being a weak young man : I feel sure that he is not .

text: Mr. Weston would not be blind to folly , though in his own son ; but he is very likely to have a more yielding , complying , mild disposition than would suit your notions of man 's perfection .
text_tokenized: Mr. Weston would not be blind to folly , though in his own son ; but he is very likely to have a more yielding , complying , mild disposition than would suit your notions of man 's perfection .

text: I dare say he has ; and though it may cut him off from some advantages , it will secure him many others . " " Yes ; all the advantages of sitting still when he ought to move , and of leading a life of mere idle pleasure , and fancying himself extremely expert in finding excuses for it .
text_tokenized: I dare say he has ; and though it may cut him off from some advantages , it will secure him many others . " " Yes ; all the advantages of sitting still when he ought to move , and of leading a life of mere idle pleasure , and fancying himself extremely expert in finding excuses for it .

text: He can sit down and write a fine flourishing letter , full of professions and falsehoods , and persuade himself that he has hit upon the very best method in the world of preserving peace at home and preventing his father 's having any right to complain .
text_tokenized: He can sit down and write a fine flourishing letter , full of professions and falsehoods , and persuade himself that he has hit upon the very best method in the world of preserving peace at home and preventing his father 's having any right to complain .

text: His letters disgust me .
text_tokenized: His letters disgust me .

text: " " Your feelings are singular .
text_tokenized: " " Your feelings are singular .

text: They seem to satisfy every body else . " " I suspect they do not satisfy Mrs. Weston .
text_tokenized: They seem to satisfy every body else . " " I suspect they do not satisfy Mrs. Weston .

text: They hardly can satisfy a woman of her good sense and quick feelings : standing in a mother 's place , but without a mother 's affection to blind her
text_tokenized: They hardly can satisfy a woman of her good sense and quick feelings : standing in a mother 's place , but without a mother 's affection to blind her

text: It is on her account that attention to Randalls is doubly due , and she must doubly feel the omission .
text_tokenized: It is on her account that attention to Randalls is doubly due , and she must doubly feel the omission .

text: Had she been a person of consequence herself , he would have come I dare say ; and it would not have signified whether he did or no .
text_tokenized: Had she been a person of consequence herself , he would have come I dare say ; and it would not have signified whether he did or no .

text: Can you think your friend behindhand in these sort of considerations ?
text_tokenized: Can you think your friend behindhand in these sort of considerations ?

text: Do you suppose she does not often say all this to herself ?
text_tokenized: Do you suppose she does not often say all this to herself ?

text: No , Emma , your amiable young man can be amiable only in French , not in English .
text_tokenized: No , Emma , your amiable young man can be amiable only in French , not in English .

text: He may be very ` aimable , ' have very good manners , and be very agreeable ; but he can have no English delicacy towards the feelings of other people : nothing really amiable about him . " " You seem determined to think ill of him .
text_tokenized: He may be very ` aimable , ' have very good manners , and be very agreeable ; but he can have no English delicacy towards the feelings of other people : nothing really amiable about him . " " You seem determined to think ill of him .

text: " Me!--not at all , " replied Mr. Knightley , rather displeased ; " I do not want to think ill of him .
text_tokenized: " Me!--not at all , " replied Mr. Knightley , rather displeased ; " I do not want to think ill of him .

text: I should be as ready to acknowledge his merits as any other man ; but I hear of none , except what are merely personal ; that he is well - grown and good - looking , with smooth , plausible manners .
text_tokenized: I should be as ready to acknowledge his merits as any other man ; but I hear of none , except what are merely personal ; that he is well - grown and good - looking , with smooth , plausible manners .

text: " Well , if he have nothing else to recommend him , he will be a treasure at Highbury .
text_tokenized: " Well , if he have nothing else to recommend him , he will be a treasure at Highbury .

text: We do not often look upon fine young men , well - bred and agreeable .
text_tokenized: We do not often look upon fine young men , well - bred and agreeable .

text: We must not be nice and ask for all the virtues into the bargain . Can not you imagine , Mr. Knightley , what a _ sensation _ his coming will produce ?
text_tokenized: We must not be nice and ask for all the virtues into the bargain . Can not you imagine , Mr. Knightley , what a _ sensation _ his coming will produce ?

text: There will be but one subject throughout the parishes of Donwell and Highbury ; but one interest-- one object of curiosity ; it will be all Mr. Frank Churchill ; we shall think and speak of nobody else .
text_tokenized: There will be but one subject throughout the parishes of Donwell and Highbury ; but one interest-- one object of curiosity ; it will be all Mr. Frank Churchill ; we shall think and speak of nobody else .

text: " You will excuse my being so much over - powered .
text_tokenized: " You will excuse my being so much over - powered .

text: If I find him conversable , I shall be glad of his acquaintance ; but if he is only a chattering coxcomb , he will not occupy much of my time or thoughts .
text_tokenized: If I find him conversable , I shall be glad of his acquaintance ; but if he is only a chattering coxcomb , he will not occupy much of my time or thoughts .

text: " My idea of him is , that he can adapt his conversation to the taste of every body , and has the power as well as the wish of being universally agreeable .
text_tokenized: " My idea of him is , that he can adapt his conversation to the taste of every body , and has the power as well as the wish of being universally agreeable .

text: To you , he will talk of farming ; to me , of drawing or music ; and so on to every body , having that general information on all subjects which will enable him to follow the lead , or take the lead , just as propriety may require , and to speak extremely well on each ; that is my idea of him .
text_tokenized: To you , he will talk of farming ; to me , of drawing or music ; and so on to every body , having that general information on all subjects which will enable him to follow the lead , or take the lead , just as propriety may require , and to speak extremely well on each ; that is my idea of him .

text: " And mine , " said Mr. Knightley warmly , " is , that if he turn out any thing like it , he will be the most insufferable fellow breathing ! What !
text_tokenized: " And mine , " said Mr. Knightley warmly , " is , that if he turn out any thing like it , he will be the most insufferable fellow breathing ! What !

text: at three - and - twenty to be the king of his company -- the great man-- the practised politician , who is to read every body 's character , and make every body 's talents conduce to the display of his own superiority ; to be dispensing his flatteries around , that he may make all appear like fools compared with himself !

text: My dear Emma , your own good sense could not endure such a puppy when it came to the point . " " I will say no more about him , " cried Emma , " you turn every thing to evil . We are both prejudiced ; you against , I for him ; and we have no chance of agreeing till he is really here .
text_tokenized: My dear Emma , your own good sense could not endure such a puppy when it came to the point . " " I will say no more about him , " cried Emma , " you turn every thing to evil . We are both prejudiced ; you against , I for him ; and we have no chance of agreeing till he is really here .

text: " Prejudiced !
text_tokenized: " Prejudiced !

text: I am not prejudiced .
text_tokenized: I am not prejudiced .

text: " But I am very much , and without being at all ashamed of it .
text_tokenized: " But I am very much , and without being at all ashamed of it .

text: My love for Mr. and Mrs. Weston gives me a decided prejudice in his favour . " " He is a person I never think of from one month 's end to another , " said Mr. Knightley , with a degree of vexation , which made Emma immediately talk of something else , though she could not comprehend why he should be angry .
text_tokenized: My love for Mr. and Mrs. Weston gives me a decided prejudice in his favour . " " He is a person I never think of from one month 's end to another , " said Mr. Knightley , with a degree of vexation , which made Emma immediately talk of something else , though she could not comprehend why he should be angry .

text: To take a dislike to a young man , only because he appeared to be of a different disposition from himself , was unworthy the real liberality of mind which she was always used to acknowledge in him ; for with all the high opinion of himself , which she had often laid to his charge , she had never before for a moment supposed it could make him unjust to the merit of another . VOLUME II
